timeline.message: chore(clients/go): include gatewayVersion in topology cmd

timeline.bodyText: Can't we assert the correct version?
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: It's null when we get it in the test
replies.author: MiguelPires

replies.bodyText: Hm, not very helpful to test I guess 😅 Is that always or just when running them from the IDE? I think the maven tests should run with the JAR itself, no? 🤔
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.message: chore(clients/go): include gatewayVersion in topology cmd

timeline.bodyText: just a nit pick, feel free to ignore, afaik if the version is blank is that that's what we set when we built the JAR, so not sure if it's all that important to check it here.
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: If we set the version to null, it will throw an NPE. I agree that if it's an empty string it's not serious since the clients already check and deal with that. But I thought it'd be better to include this since this way the clients don't have to deal with random whitespace, since the version will be either something or an empty string
replies.author: MiguelPires

timeline.message: chore(clients/go): include gatewayVersion in topology cmd
chore(gateway): move gatewayVersion into topology RPC
chore(clients/java): include gatewayVersion in topology cmd
chore(clients/go): include gatewayVersion in topology cmd
